title: Some people who seek abortions can face prison time in more than 120 countries, analysis shows
description: People who seek or obtain abortions can face prison time in more than 120 countries, according to an analysis of abortion penalties around the world.

title: Super-sized trapdoor spider discovered in Australia
description: Researchers in Australia have made a big discovery: a super-sized species of trapdoor spider found only in Central Queensland.

title: Chinese President Xi, Putin discuss Ukraine peace plan
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin welcomed his visiting Chinese counterpart’s Ukraine plan as “the basis for a peaceful settlement, when they are ready for that in the West and in Kyiv.” Xi Jinping insisted China had always “adhered to an objective and impartial position.”

title: China’s Xi visits Putin in Moscow to underline ‘no-limits’ friendship
description: The pair held talks at the Kremlin and signed an agreement of mutual cooperation, a boost for the embattled Russian president after the International Criminal Court issued a warrant for his arrest.

title: Ukraine hints it blew up Russian missiles in occupied Crimea
description: A “mysterious explosion” destroyed Russian cruise missiles that were being transported through occupied Crimea, Ukraine said Tuesday, days after President Vladimir Putin visited the Black-Sea region.

title: How Putin’s meetings with Xi could impact the war in Ukraine
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin are holding official talks in Moscow in a meeting that could have a major impact on the war in Ukraine. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer has the details.

title: Saudi Arabia frees American who was jailed over critical tweets about crown prince
description: Saudi Arabia has freed 72-year-old American Saad Ibrahim Almadi, who had been jailed over critical tweets, his son said Tuesday.

title: Finland’s joyful streak continues, winning ‘happiest country in the world’ title for the sixth time
description: It calls itself the “land of the midnight sun” because of its nightless days during the summer and perhaps the extra light has affected the mood in Finland, which has once again taken the crown for the “happiest country in the world.”

title: Unrest follows no-confidence vote in French government
description: More than 200 people were arrested across France on Monday evening, police said, after spontaneous protests broke out hours after the government of President Emmanuel Macron narrowly survived a no-confidence vote.

title: Beijing still seeking answers a year after China Eastern plane crash
description: China’s aviation regulator is still investigating the cause of last year’s crash of China Eastern Airlines Flight MU5735, which killed all 132 people on board.

title: ‘No such thing’ as Palestinian people, top Israeli minister says
description: A firebrand Israeli minister claimed there’s “no such thing” as a Palestinian people as Israel’s new coalition government, its most hard-line ever, plowed ahead on Monday with a part of its plan to overhaul the judiciary.

title: Macron to address nation after government survives no-confidence vote
description: French President Emmanuel Macron will break his silence on Wednesday to outline plans after his administration survived a no-confidence motion in Parliament.

title: London police force is racist, misogynistic and homophobic, report finds
description: London police have lost the confidence of the public because of deep-seated racism, misogyny and homophobia, according to an independent review.

title: IMF to assess Sri Lankan governance as part of $3 billion bailout
description: The IMF said Tuesday it is assessing Sri Lanka’s governance in the first case of an Asian country facing scrutiny for corruption as part of a bailout program.
